intro: Hieracium ohlsenii, commonly known as the Ohlsen's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
